intro: Neolloydia unguispina, commonly known as the spiny leaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant features elliptical leaves with a rough, spiny texture along the margins, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Neolloydia unguispina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blossoms.
